title: Knowing how to lose lane is important
body: Everyone loses lane.  It's ok.  Really.  But there is just no reason that you should be going 1/12.  Ok, I get it, Riven's killed you twice and now she can dive you.  You're just gonna have to give up some farm, buddy. Come back in the mid/late game.  Losing lane is totally ok.  Feeding just isn't. :-/

replies.body:
Unfortunately, 2 kills top is enough for the enemy top and jungler to constantly dive you just because of the sheer numbers advantage.

Had a Garen on my team just constantly getting dived after dying twice early. There was literally nothing he could do, he never left the tower and still died.

> [{quoted}](name=Lost In Time,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-19T06:17:50.279+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, 2 kills top is enough for the enemy top and jungler to constantly dive you just because of the sheer numbers advantage.
> 
> Had a Garen on my team just constantly getting dived after dying twice early. There was literally nothing he could do, he never left the tower and still died.

The sad thing is that people would sooner flame that Garen and tell him to kill himself than just come kill the person diving him that is blatantly overextended.

>gank riven

double kill
One doesn't simply gank a riven
and that, people, is why turrets need buffs
Dude come on what you have to do is ward the ways the enemy jungler can gank you when you are at turret and just back off if they are able to dive you at full hp

This post should get more up`s than main post above us. No offense, most noobs don`t understand league entirely, but judge other players by what they`re going through. Nearly every player in league will get the experience of the so 1/12 player this person is complaining about.

This is true, but there's a counter argument to that as well. If a top lane champ KNOWS they can't survive in lane bc they will be dove, and the enemy isn't freezing at tower, they can roam and get back in the game by getting kills ganking, or pushing lanes out on a gank and taking tower, or maybe even just taking dragon or something. If the enemy pushes hard and drops the outer tower early then the top has a chance to let the enemy push to second tower and freeze if their team can keep from getting dove by the fed enemy top, or shove and keep roaming if they can't let the enemy roam. If the enemy stays in lane they have to extend a very long way without a tower to fall back to and jungle or even jungle and mid can gank (say if jungle ganks mid and gets a kill then they both roam). Sometimes abandoning lane to let them take tower can be a tactical advantage if you know how to abuse the lack of laning safety and not get abused bc top can roam or go into your jungle easy.

The sad thing is that some people are literally clueless as to what they can do roaming, they kinda just walk around for a bit. Maybe show up in another lane, not a gank, just kinda walk up in there and start CSing. Or wandering into a clearly unsafe area and die. Then wait for their tier 2 turret to hit %30 before they recall and walk to it, while losing a massive wave in the process. In spite of the face that you pinged the wave 5 times as it got closer. The whole time complaining that they got no ganks or {{champion:92}} IS TOO OP{{item:3070}}

not to mention even under tower were riven can 0-100 you
tank 3-4 tower shots and get away with her kit with just enough hp to make you insane but not enough were you felt like you got outplayed and

> [{quoted}](name=Lost In Time,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-19T06:17:50.279+0000)
>
> Unfortunately, 2 kills top is enough for the enemy top and jungler to constantly dive you just because of the sheer numbers advantage.
> 
> Had a Garen on my team just constantly getting dived after dying twice early. There was literally nothing he could do, he never left the tower and still died.

But the nice thing about toplane is you don't have to stay top in that situation. Early on there are few objectives to control up there save for towers. You go mid/bot and start crushing the other lanes if your jungler isn't/cant come top to counter gank, and then when the enemy toplaner joins the first teamfight you don't die so fast and they get two shot by your adc.

Also warding deep helps so if you do know the enemy jungler wants to just dive you then you can simply back out and let them take the tower. Yeah it sucks but they lose a lot of map pressure if your team knows they're up there and all they get is a tower and no kills.

There are often two problems with this.

Firstly is communication leading to co-operation, it can be very hard to convince team mates that you haven't met before to help you relentlessly roam and apply pressure unconventionally.

Secondly is your own power, as you have already fallen behind you are likely at a level disadvantage to everyone else in the game, your ganking power will be weak and you run a high risk of dying unless assisted by another lane, which ties into the first point.

Overcoming these however will get you back up to speed and avoid a snowball.
Yes, but Riven is a shit example.  There's no way to lose lane gracefully against Riven.

Had a top lane {{champion:157}} feed {{champion:92}} soo hard, and none of us criticized or BM him for it, it was more like "Yup just another normal day in LOL annoying Rivens curb stomping my team so hard we start to become numb to the impending defeat." in the end we either:

- Delete Riven as a team, slowly killing off our enemy teams moral and win.

Or

- We get deleted as individuals running in blind 1v2's and feeding the rest of the enemy team until we lose.

There is no in between...unless you have a fed and competent {{champion:11}} on your team..then you MIGHT stand a chance.

Riven will destroy Yasuo in lane though, nothing he can really do about it.

That's why I don't understand why people take Yasuo top.
I'm guessing ever since {{item:3078}} became a popular item on him and he was played top in LCS that's when people started playing him

> [{quoted}](name=DazedOnlooker,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-09-19T15:40:46.091+0000)

> 
> - Delete Riven as a team, slowly killing off our enemy teams moral and win.
> 
> Or
> 
> - We get deleted as individuals running in blind 1v2's and feeding the rest of the enemy team until we lose.
> 
> There is no in between...unless you have a fed and competent {{champion:11}} on your team..then you MIGHT stand a chance.

reminds me when a friend of mine played yi (not in the jungle iirc) and killed riven in 0.1sec (literally, everyone was surprised and many wtfs were hard)

> [{quoted}](name=haaaaaaaalp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-19T06:21:26.754+0000)
>
> With the way gold works, isn't it far more efficient to feed and get cs than to stay back after a certain point? Your gold per kill falls off a cliff and it makes more sense for you try to get as much gold as possible.

No.  It's more efficient to give up the outer turret and farm on your side of the map.  If they push and try to get you at that point your team should be able to collapse on them and kill them relatively easily.  They still get a decent amount of gold from killing you for quite a few kills and you can't farm when your dead.

> [{quoted}](name=haaaaaaaalp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-09-19T07:30:07.304+0000)
>
> Why would they push? Wouldn't they just freeze the lane outside of turret range until they are strong enough to snowball other lanes?

Why would they push and take a turret?  That's kind of the point of the game.

> [{quoted}](name=AtheosisX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-19T08:08:09.580+0000)
>
> Why would they push and take a turret?  That's kind of the point of the game.

When they can completely deny farm and maybe even experience of their lane counterpart, they can always take tower later. It's like.. 5v4 right now as you rendered your counterpart useless.

> [{quoted}](name=AtheosisX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-19T08:08:09.580+0000)
>
> Why would they push and take a turret?  That's kind of the point of the game.

You don't try to take the turret as fast as possible if you want to snowball hard. Give em a sense of security, then dive their ass when they at half health ({{champion:39}} ).
[On Zoning When Ahead](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/GFcgLXXF-psa-you-win-a-lane-hard-by-zoning-when-ahead-not-by-going-all-in-over)

There were a few relevant nerfs back when proxy singed became popular. He'd just farm and feed repeatedly to the point that he was worth less than a minion, but still relevant because he never allowed you to push and he got so much farm. So, Riot changed the kill gold system to also take into account CS: every 100 CS is like getting a kill, and pushes your gold value back up (only if it is negative).

> [{quoted}](name=haaaaaaaalp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-19T06:21:26.754+0000)
>
> With the way gold works, isn't it far more efficient to feed and get cs than to stay back after a certain point? Your gold per kill falls off a cliff and it makes more sense for you try to get as much gold as possible.

There's a psychological aspect to this though. If you're not playing Singed, and your team sees that the enemy top laner is 7/0 and you're 1/7, they're not going to stop and think "Oh, well at least he has 40 more CS than he would have" they're going to think "GG, our top sucks, ff at 20".

> [{quoted}](name=haaaaaaaalp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2015-09-20T22:23:44.759+0000)
>
> That is on the allies then. The player in question is minimizing the gold disadvatage his team is in going into the midgame. If that player's allies is too incompetent to figure that out then:
> 
> a) that is the fault of the player's alies
> b) the team probably won't win anyway because they do not understand the basic aspects of gold gain
> 
> The entire "well it is possible the player's allies are idiots and do not understand how the game works" is not a good reason to stray away from the optimal way of playing the game for the team.

Except that it's not "well it's possible", it's pretty much guaranteed that you will have at least one flaming or raging teammate these days, if you feed extensively.
for junglers in solo queue, there is a secret to helping those who've lost lane (esp top). and it requires the enemy top laner to have taken the outer turret.

See, i'm used to winning lane most games and having the jungler start camping me the moment I take the enemy turret is frustrating. I got tired of it so I wisened up lol. Now if i'm winning lane I intentionally leave the outer turret standing for as long as possible and just buy items after each kill. Then I continue to farm kills off my opponent each time they come back to lane, rinse and repeat over and over again. You would not believe how many games I have gone 10+/0 in lane with my boy {{champion:122}} simply because I never took their turret and they kept falling for it.

Of course the rest of my team usually feeds extremely hard those games and says that somehow i'm the one who lost the game for them because I didn't roam as a fed Darius, but that's another story.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-09-19T19:14:11.622+0000)
>
> See, i'm used to winning lane most games and having the jungler start camping me the moment I take the enemy turret is frustrating. I got tired of it so I wisened up lol. Now if i'm winning lane I intentionally leave the outer turret standing for as long as possible and just buy items after each kill. Then I continue to farm kills off my opponent each time they come back to lane, rinse and repeat over and over again. You would not believe how many games I have gone 10+/0 in lane with my boy {{champion:122}} simply because I never took their turret and they kept falling for it.
> 
> Of course the rest of my team usually feeds extremely hard those games and says that somehow i'm the one who lost the game for them because I didn't roam as a fed Darius, but that's another story.

If you get that fed and don't roam or TP gank you deserve to lose.

It's normals so I focus more on my lane mechanics and snowballing a lane than helping others. Dont worry in ranked I play to win.

Also this was mainly on pre-rework Darius who had no reason to roam unless he wanted to get peeled and shutdown.

One time I was under tower and an Ori ulted me out of tower range for a bit, then they killed me right after I got back in range. Some people can displace you...

Guys I really appreciate this thread, most of you seem to agree and have really good points. Yes, diving is a thing. But my point is just that feeding is the worst thing you can do. Players really don't understand the negative effect of dying over and over again. It's much better to not CS and just soak experience than to die over and over. 
This causes you to give the enemy team a lot of gold, you miss out on team fights, CS, and experience. It's such a compounding issue.
I lost lane last game, but the most disappointing thing was that I fed 1-12.

played a game as {{champion:119}}  tonight against a very original enemy bot lane team comp of {{champion:429}} {{champion:53}} \

Fcking sarcasm btw

these guys went and stood in between me and the minions for nearly all laning phase. if we got near. blitz either ran in for a knock up or hooked for a rotation while kalista did work. I couldnt do anything because throwing an axe meant i either left it or blitz aimed for the landing. My supp couldnt do anything because moving in to harass met the same free grab rotation from blitz.

they hardly even bothered with CS unless we moved out from under tower and our harass was so shit because their rotation was so strong our jungle would only get killed for helping because they weren't taking any damage from us.

it eventually got to the point that when they hit 6. blitz ran under the tower, ran his rotation, hooked someone into kalista, and she ulted him out when he was close to dying.

i then spent the entire game being called a shit draven by my team because Dravens biggest counters were diving a tower for me every time i walked into lane.

you dont get to win lane by playing safe sometimes. You dont get to win under towers. if you're countered enough, you dont get to win until laning phase where you can make it back up and you hope to fcking god you managed to feed as little as possible until then.

in all honesty that duo was so toxic they had about 5 kills between them from myself and my supp i was literally telling my team that they were not to come into my lane for any reason. The jungle walked in and died instantly and never came back. my friend whom i had in chat read my message and didnt believe me. he died instantly and i cursed him out saying "when i say dont come into my lane for any reason at any point period. dont do it. this lane is lost. dont come back. help someone else."

we lost. even after killing the two of them eventually they couldnt be stopped. blitz never left kalista and spoon fed her all game. we couldnt help our jungle, our mid, or ourselves.

so tl;dr

if all you can do is lose, and feed, give up on kills, and if you have to, cs, until roaming phase and good help. pretending that you can atleast try to cs is a sham. its baits you into dying more.
This sounds like the time I played Nasus against a Lee Sin top. Pretty much couldn't do shit.

This feels like a game i had recently playing {{champion:117}} sup with my {{champion:429}} adc. We were up against {{champion:80}} {{champion:89}} combo, and we got stomped. Hard..Usually as lulu i'm aggressive as hell but the risk of being chained cc'd would keep me from harassing as often as i was used to. and whenever leona would catch any of us out it was automatic game over because panth would just follow up with her in right after and blow us up...i was essentially getting punished for harassing so after the 2nd death i decided to play very passive..it felt like i was playing against 2 blitzcrank's being zoned to infinity, they would even tower dive us any chance we got so farming under turret was nearly impossible. and my adc was too passive to begin with, often not harassing back when she became a target,peeling was easy but never enough to save us, so we would often end up taking dmg for free, then she finally got angry with me telling me "Your not playing aggressive enough"......wut?. they were doing a damn good job positioning themselves around their minions near each other, while my kalista was busy running farming simulator 2015 and hoping around near mindlessly making it difficult for me to follow up with her or vice versa. harassing essentially became suicidal because whenever i wanted to go in, my adc would be too far away to save me if they happen to catch me(or her) out. i alway get jumped on for being aggressive and she would often leave me to die instead of targeting the adc after an engage..but "This lulu sup sux, bot lane fed them omg" and our jungler NEVER pinged that he was coming to gank, so the enemy would just kite him to safety while i'm sitting under turret wondering why the enemy was falling back. But still i'm not being aggressive enough, and had no clue how to deal with the opposing teams bot lane combo k.

I abandoned bot lane after my adc died for the 2nd time, then she would cry for the rest of the game about how "this team sucks at this game, always leaving me to solo bot" even though we clearly lost, dafuq? wut are you still doing soloing that lost lane?? fk that lane i'm camping top and mid. u know the lanes that didn't crash and burn?. She proceeded to feed more until we ff@20..well we all fed later but i think her deaths were much more stupid and could have been avoided had she stayed with the rest of us.
nice {{item:3070}} thread.

This is a stupid post.  Towers basically don't exist once the enemy has 2 kills on you especially if they're playing any of Riot's most recent favourite children.  I'd like to see you play any mage mid give 2 kills to Diana and lets see how safe you are behind your tower.

> [{quoted}](name=Halo of the Sun,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aejtiaAK,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-09-20T13:15:31.745+0000)
>
> This is a stupid post.  Towers basically don't exist once the enemy has 2 kills on you especially if they're playing any of Riot's most recent favourite children.  I'd like to see you play any mage mid give 2 kills to Diana and lets see how safe you are behind your tower.

you're relatively safe vs a diana under tower compared to someone like zed or ekko though.

Im very good at loosing lane in a solo lane, when i support however sometimes depends how good in loosing lane my ADC is, so sometimes Im half as good in bot lane :D

But depending on the champion I really lack risky plays and I rarely engage in a fight that has 50-50 chance of me wining it, jungling in normal's helped me a bit to resolve this issue to an extent, but I'm still rarely the one that gets a quadra... hell even triple almost never happens.

What im trying to say is that this... "good" at loosing lane; it depends a lot on the personal play style, players cant stay in the opposite play style for long in a match.
I have friend that is the opposite of me, he knows how to stall the opposite laners success but he cant stand playing like me longer than 7 min (I actually keep tabs when he is loosing lane), But when he is ahead he wins with multy-kills. I also can charge for about 5 minutes until im killed then I get back to may safe play and waiting on the team.

The ones who thrive on assists like me can keep the enemy busy even when they loose, so my friend that thrives on death-matches can have time to make his build and stomp them :D .
your were in my game with the 1/14/1 yi top weren't you

I've got a feeling that Olaf is a little overpowered right now. He can slow lock you, and when you have no escapes, that's huge. Second, you can't duel him, because he attacks faster when he get's lower, to the point of TWO ATTACK SPEED at LEVEL 7 with a Vamp Scepter(?). Third, that also means he's really good at diving, because the turret shots will only make him hit you faster. Ragnorak stops your CC's, and he whacks away at you. Fourth, if you're running away, he can throw his Q at you repeatedly. If he hits, he gets 1-2 auto's off before he reaches his axe again, and then he throws it again. If he misses, he just picks it up and THROWS it _Again_. It's really sad... because landing a single Q let's him stay on top of you...
